info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:17PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Jo Daviess and Stephenson Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 716 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nora to near Cedarville to near Durand. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Freeport, Lena, Cedarville, Davis, Dakota, Winslow, Rock City, Ridott, Buena Vista, Rock Grove, Oneco, Orangeville, Waddams Grove, Eleroy, Red Oak, Damascus, Lake Le-Aqua- na State Park, Mc Connell, Afolkey and Scioto Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Illinois.
